author: hdmoadmin
title: It’s Game Day!
text:
5:05 am - October 16, 2015 It’s Game Day! 
TODAY’S TICKET : Paris at Booneville 
GAME : Booneville (1-5, 0-3) vs Paris (3-3, 2-1) 
MASCOTS : Booneville Bearcats; Paris Eagles 
WHEN : 7 p.m., Friday, Oct. 16 at Bearcat Stadium 
SERIES : Booneville leads 45-35-6 (.558) 
LAST MEETING : Booneville 34 Paris 14 on Oct. 17, 2014 
LAST WEEK : Lamar 54 Booneville 7; Paris 27 Lavaca 0 
STREAK : Booneville has won last 9 
FIRST MEETING : Booneville 12 Paris 12 on Oct. 7, 1922 
CONFERENCE AFFILIATIONS : Both are members of the 3A-4. 
BROADCAST : The Fort 94.5 and on the radio station’s website 
NOTES : Taiton Mitchell’s six catches against Lamar last week is the most by a Bearcat receiver since Dennis Jones caught seven against Mansfield in 1969. 
Although there was a gap between 2006 to 2013, tonight’s meeting with Paris marks the 87 th time the two schools have played, which is the most against any opponent for the Bearcats. The game was once a regular Thanksgiving Cay affair. 
THIS DATE IN BEARCAT HISTORY: The Bearcats are 9-3-1 all time in games documented to have been played on Oct. 16. Ten different schools have been an Oct. 16 opponent, none of which has been Paris. 
On Oct. 16, 1998 at Lamar then-sophomore Trey Holloway drew the start at quarterback and he and Brandon Rowland threw for a combined 120 yards in a 35-0 win. Rowland also ran 90 yards for a touchdown in the game. 
The Oct. 16, 1981 game was a nail-biter with the Bearcats beating Greenwood 8-7. Benny Sanderson hit Mark Merrill for 66 yards and the touchdown and the Bearcats won it with a two point conversion. Okay it that’s not ironic enough to have Booneville beat Greenwood via the pass, there were also four Bearcat interceptions that night, by John Massey, Merrill, Doug Shott and Alan King. 
Randy May also had a four touchdown night against Waldron on Oct. 16, 1992 in a game the Bearcats won 35-12.
